Value.label: Type of command no. 2
Value.Help: Type of input no. 2, what the input 1 will report if no contact is made

Value.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 2
Value.Help: Possible parameter settings: (1 - 63) and 255. When setting 255 will automatically be set dimmer to the previous condition i.e 30% or what the last state was.

Value.label: Type of commands no. 2
Value.Help: Type of commands to association group 2

Value.label: Type of command no. 3
Value.Help: Type of input no. 3, what the input 3 will report if no contact is made

Value.label: Forced Level of Dimming group 3
Value.Help: Possible parameter settings: (1 - 63) and 255. When setting 255 will automatically be set dimmer to the previous condition i.e 30% or what the last state was.

Value.label: Type of commands no. 3
Value.Help: Type of commands to association group 3

Value.label: Status change signalled by LED
Value.Help: Status change signalled by LED. Default setting: LED turned On

Value.label: Sent in the Lifeline
Value.Help: Select the type of command to be sent in the Lifeline

Value.label: Input 3 contact type
Value.Help: Default value 0

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system. Default value 255.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 second to 32536 seconds Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto ON disabled. 1 second to 32535 seconds Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable 3-way switch/additional switch
Value.Help: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default). Enabling 3-way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable/Disable Double click function
Value.Help: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Saving the state of the relay after a power failure
Value.Help: Default value 0.

Item.label: Flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time change for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 5.

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 second to 32767 seconds reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value. Default value 300 (power report in Watts is send each 300s).

Value.label: Minimum dimming value
Value.Help: 1 - 98 = 1% - 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 1 (Minimum dimming value is 1%).

Value.label: Maximum dimming value
Value.Help: 2 - 99 = 2% - 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming values is set by entered value. Default value 99 (Maximum dimming value is 99%).

Value.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
Value.Help: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through. 1- 255 = 10mseconds - 2550mseconds (2,55s), step is 10mseconds. Default value 100 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 1s).

Value.label: Dimming time when key pressed
Value.Help: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continues hold of push button I1. 1- 255 = 1 second - 255 seconds. Default value 3 (Dimming time between min. and max. dimming values is 3s).

Value.label: Ignore start level
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 4. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1. Default value 0.

Value.label: Dimming duration
Value.Help: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value. Default value 0.

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3 or select Notification Type and Event
Value.Help: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint. Endpoint device type selection: notification sensor (1 - 6) sensor binary (9). NOTE: After parameter change, module has to be re included into the network in order setting to take effect! Default value 1.

Item.label: Home Security; Motion Detection, unknown location.
Carbon Monoxide; Carbon Monoxide detected, unknown location.
Carbon Dioxide; Carbon Dioxide detected, unknown location.
Water Alarm; Water Leak detected, unknown location.
Heat Alarm; Overheat detected, unknown location
Smoke Alarm; Smoke detected, unknown location

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. 32536 : offset is 0.0C. From 1 to 100 : value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 : value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature. Default value 32536.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. 0 : Reporting disabled. 1- 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C. Default value 5 = 0,5C change.

Group.label: Start level change/stop level change input I1
Start level change/stop level change input I1

Value.label: Countdown timer
Value.Help: Number of minutes before it shutdown automatically (0 = disabled).

Value.label: Power state
Value.Help: Define how the plug will react after the power supply is back on.

Value.label: LED indicator
Value.Help: Set the intensity of the LED indicator (0-100).

Value.label: Countdown timer
Value.Help: Number of minutes before it shutdown automatically (0 = disabled).

Value.label: Power state
Value.Help: Define how the plug will react after the power supply is back on.

Value.label: LED indicator
Value.Help: Set the intensity of the LED indicator (0-100).

Value.label: Basic Set Off Level
Value.Help: Control the value represented by the left-side in area D. E.g. Setting this configuration to 15 means range of Command Basic Set value start from 15

Value.label: Basic Set On Level
Value.Help: Control the value represented by the right-side in area D. E.g. Setting this configuration to 15 means range of Command Basic Set value start from 15

Value.label: Auto report battery time
Value.Help: The interval time for auto reporting the Battery level. 0 means turn off auto report battery. The default value is 12.

Value.label: Customer function
Value.Help: Bit 0: Dimmer setting method. 0 : Auto send Command Basic Set after rotating. 1 : Send Command Basic Set by touching key after rotating Bit 1: Disable buzzer in timer mode. 0: Enable. 1: Disable.

Value.label: Scene Holding report
Value.Help: Send Central Scene Holding when the button is held.

Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts on power change
Value.Help: Set value from 0 - 100 (0% - 100%). 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 to 100 = 1% to 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power (in Watts) in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. Default value 1

Value.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
Value.Help: Set value means time interval (0 - 32767) in seconds, when power report is send. 0 - Reporting Disabled. 1 - 32767) = 1second - 32767) seconds, Reporting enabled. Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.

Value.label: Self-measurement
Value.Help: Module may include power and energy used by module itself in reports sent to the main controller

Value.label: Operating modes
Value.Help: Defines selection between two available operating modes. 0 Shutter mode 1 Venetian mode (up/down and slate tilting) Note: When setting parameter, module needs to be reconfigured! Please check detailed description in this manual.

Value.label: Slats tilting full turn time
Value.Help: Defines the time necessary for slats to make full turn (180 degrees). 0 Tilting time disabled 1 to 32767 = 0,01seconds to 327,67 seconds Note: If time set is too high, this will result that after full turn, shutter will start move up or down, for time remaining.

Value.label: Slats position
Value.Help: This parameter defines slats position after up/down movement through UI or push buttons, return to previously set position only in case of 0 - UI control. 1 - UI control, momentary switch operation, or when the limit switch is reached. 2 - UI control, Push button, Limit switch is reached, after receiving a STOP control frame from UI. ( Default value 2 )

Item.label: UI control, momentary switch operation, limit switch is reached
UI control, push button, limit switch is reached, STOP Frame

Value.label: Motor moving up/down time
Value.Help: Defines shutter motor moving time of complete opening or complete closing. 0 - moving time disabled (working with limit switches) 1 - 32767 = 0,1seconds - 3276,7seconds. After that time motor is stopped (relay goes to off state) See complete note in documentation.

Value.label: Motor operation detection
Value.Help: Power threshold to be interpreted when motor reach the limit switch. Available settings: 5 to 100 (0,5 W to 10 W), step is 0,1W.

Value.label: Forced Shutter calibration
Value.Help: By modifying the parameters setting, Shutter enters the calibration mode. (after shutter performs the calibration process, completing full cycle - up, down and up, set the parameter value back to default. )

Value.label: Power reporting to controller
Value.Help: Defines if reporting regarding power level, multilevel, etc.., are reported to controller or not.

Value.label: Power consumption max delay time
Value.Help: Defines the max time before motor power consumption is read after one of the relays is switched ON. If there is no power consumption during this max time (motor not connected, damaged or requires higher time to start, motor in end position,...) the relay will switch OFF. Available settings: 3 - 50 = 0,3 seconds - 5 seconds (100ms resolution).

Value.label: Power consumption at limit switch delay time
Value.Help: Defines the max time at limit switch, when power consumption is below power threshold. If the power consumption during this time is below power threshold (par. 76), the active output will switch off, means that limit switch is reached. Available settings: 3 - 50 = 0,3 seconds - 5 seconds (100ms resolution).

Value.label: Delay time between outputs
Value.Help: Defines the time delay between output relay switching (time between switching up/down and vice versa). Available settings: 1 - 30 = 0,1 seconds - 3 seconds (100ms resolution).

Value.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
Value.Help: From 1 to 100 - value from 0.1 C to 10.0 C is added to actual measured temperature. From 1001 to 1100 - value from -0.1 C to -10.0 C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

Value.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
Value.Help: If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available settings: 0 - Reporting disabled. 1 - 127 = 0,1C - 12,7C, step is 0,1C.

Group.label: Basic on/off of the input I1 state
Basic on/off of the input I2 state
Basic on/off of the input I1 state
Basic on/off of the input I2 state
